Since JIRA is licensed per user it is important for administrators to identify users based on actions / usage metrics. Common fields that would need to be searched would be:

Reporter (number of issues reported in a period of time)
Watcher (number of issues being watched in a period of time)
Assignee (number of issues assigned to them in a period of time)
Pretty much any field with a user picker 

I think that this should be added to the Filter Users page in the Administration section.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When submitting a request to JIRA, if this contains both basic auth an a session cookie ({{JSESSIONID}}), JIRA will log in that user again, however will reuse the existing session.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a new admin session by logging in.
# Create an issue.
# Extract the JSESSIONID from one of the HTTP responses.
# Check the session in the *User Sesssions* section.
# Submit a GET to an issue, with basic auth (ie Authorization header) and the JSESSIONID. This was done with:
{noformat}
curl -L http://jira-url:8080/jira/browse/ABC-1 -H 'Cookie: JSESSIONID=<session cookie>' -u admin:admin
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results

JIRA does not log in again (ie the basic auth is ignored).

h3. Actual Results

JIRA does login again, as can be seen below:

Original login:

{noformat}
2016-02-19 12:13:08,474 http-nio-60710-exec-21 admin 733x1224x1 - 172.22.49.28 /browse/WITI-75 The user 'admin' has PASSED authentication.
{noformat}

Submitting the GET:

{noformat}
2016-02-19 12:20:22,358 http-nio-60710-exec-17 admin 740x1374x1 - 172.22.49.28 /browse/WITI-75 The user 'admin' has PASSED authentication.
{noformat}

h3. Notes

This can create significant problems if requests are used that submits the {{Authorization}} header and also the {{JSESSIONID}} session cookie, as large amounts of requests will be constantly logging in. If using LDAP, this will create additional load on that server, and can result in production outages due to significant spikes in memory and CPU usage.

I was not able to locate a RFC on this, so this may actually not be a bug and rather a suggestion to alter JIRA for this behaviour. I'm not sure why a client would ever submit both.

RFC's reviewed:

* [HTTP State Management Mechanism|https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6265].
* [HTTP Authentication: Basic and Digest Access Authentication|https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2617.txt].

h3. Workaround

It's possible to strip the {{Authorization}} header on a reverse-proxy if the session cookie exists. For example in Apache:

{code}
SetEnvIfNoCase Cookie ^(.*)JSESSIONID(.*)lin$ ALREADY_AUTH
RequestHeader unset Authorization env=ALREADY_AUTH
{code}
fields.summary: JIRA / Tomcat logs in user again when Authorization header and Cookie are included

fields.description:
I've been hitting this for months but only just now managed to reliably reproduce it.

0) Use Slo-Mo set to 2000ms
1) Bring up quick-create 
2) Fill in all mandatory fields
3) Type an @mention in the description field and click create before the autocomplete response to the mention returns.

At this point, the issue is created in the background, a confirmation dialog will be _just discernable_ behind the quick-create window which remains open, and there's no clear indication that the issue was created.

4) Click "Create".

The quick-create window closes, it shows the issue key for the second issue that was created, and the user doesn't know that two issues were created.

------

This can be tricky to repro, please do not close this as "Cannot Repro" without chatting with me first.
fields.summary: Race condition in quick-create causes duplicate issues to be created

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28707].
  {panel}

Found on v5.1-kickass9#757-sha1:a700ce2. If a user updates 2 single fields and the responses are received in reverse order it looks like update 2 never happened.

Steps to reproduce:
* Open up Charles proxy and set a breakpoint on the URL that the inline edit uses (IIRC it's /EditAction)
* Open an issue and edit its Priority. Click the checkbox. The request will show up in Charles's breakpoint view.
* On the same issue, type in a comment and click "Add". The 2nd request will show up in Charles' breakpoint view. Click Execute on this 2nd request. The comment appears on your issue.
* Now click Execute on the 1st request. The changed Priority appears on the issue, but the comment disappears. (!)
* Reload the page and both the changed Priority and the added Comment are visible.

Network latency can cause this to happen in real world usage. We should implement inline edit in such a way that the order of received responses does not affect what eventually gets shown (after all responses are in).

cc [~jcreenaune], [~sharwood]
fields.summary: Inline edit shows older version of issue if edit responses are received out of order

fields.description:
In Firefox, under certain circumstances the preview mode of wiki markup fields misses out on an event that should cause it to implicitly save and leave preview mode. If you focus a browser UI control that is not part of the page (e.g. a Bonfire button or the search text box) _and then you click the Comment button_, the preview mode does not trigger a save as it should. It stays in preview until something else causes the save.

Repro Steps:
1. Inline Edit the Description field and click the Preview icon.
2. Click in the Firefox Search Engine text field (or the Bonfire attach button)
3. Click on the Comment button in the issue.

Notice that Description field is still in inline-edit preview mode.
fields.summary: Preview mode of inline edit can miss a "blur" event

fields.description:
Clicking 'Retry Operation' on XSRF Token missing Error dialog, results in BAD Request.
1. Launch the Quick Edit dialog.
2. Intercept the request and change the atl_token, run the request.
3. Update issue
4. This would result in XSRF Token Error dialog with 'Retry Button'.
5. click on 'Retry Operation' button, this does not turn the dialog OFF, 
Request results in 400 - Bad Request error.

Video Capture: http://screencast.com/t/JtAwWsxpxK3


Network log !requestlog.png!

On exploring this issue more, the reason for the failure of "Retry Operation" is because the Issue Update failure, E.g. invalid value in a field, failed to fill in a required field which was recently added and user is updating an old issue.
fields.summary: With Quick Edit dialog, Retry Operation on XSRF Token Missing Error dialog, fails.

Hello team,

The dashboard filter error messages only display the filter number. 
The user has no way of knowing what filter this corresponds except if running a SQL query to match the number to a filter name. This behavior is unwanted if you have users which can fix the filters but doesn't have the necessary grants to query the database.

See attached screen capture.

Thanks,

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28665].
  {panel}

We are heavily using the sub-tasks to split work packages for developers and we create hundreds of them. The parent issue is just used as a container to wrap all the sub-tasks. Our problem is that in terms of reporting and managing the work, one would almost certainly only want to look at the parent issue level (either directly at the issue or in a report) but the parent issue does not include any information from the sub-task.

I imagine this should function like the "Include Sub-tasks" feature for Estimates, where you can either just show the values of the parent or the accumulated values of the sub-tasks. Thus the activity log would show for the parent:

User ABC commented on ABC-42 - foobar not working
User XYZ started progress on ABC-42 / ABC-23 - Initial Investigation
...
fields.summary: "Include Sub-tasks" for Activity Log / Comments / Work Log of parent issue

fields.description:
{quote} Here are the following steps on how to reproduce this bug: 1. Set up Application Link between JIRA 4.4 or 5.0 and any Confluence higher than 3.5 (Trusted Apps or OAuth authentication are fine) 2. Under one single project in JIRA (e.g: TEST project), try creating a few issues 3. Access to a Confluence page and edit that page 4. Try inserting JIRA Issues Macro by grabbing the XML URL from the JIRA issues: - http://10.60.1.174:8440/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/temp/SearchRequest.xml?jqlQuery=project+%3D+TEST&tempMax=1000 | 5. Set the Cache to Off 6. Click on 'Refresh' button 7. The JIRA Issues Macro got displayed successfully as per this screen shot: !JIRA_Issues_Macro_Success.jpg|thumbnail! 8. Then, go to JIRA 4.4 User Profile and change the Language to *any other Language pack other than English (United States or UK)* 9. Go back to the same Confluence page and try to insert JIRA Issues Macro by clicking on 'Refresh' button 10. You will be seeing the following error thrown inside JIRA Issues: bq. Unable to generate JSON output
class java.io.IOException !JIRA_Issues_Macro_Fail.jpg|thumbnail! (i) For Danish (Denmark), Dutch (Belgium), German (Germany), and German (Switzerland) language, it happens intermittently - sometimes success and sometimes fail Not only JIRA Issues Macro that is having this problem, even inserting a JIRA Macro is also having the same problem. For example: {noformat} {jira:project = TEST|server=Your Company JIRA|cache=off} {noformat} I have tried the same behavior with JIRA 4.3.x against Confluence 3.5.x and this problem does not occur in JIRA 4.3.x. This means that this problem arises only from JIRA 4.4 onwards. {quote}
fields.summary: Language Packs other than English do not display JIRA Macro and JIRA Issues Macro correctly (regression from JRA-25755)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28652].
  {panel}

Hi,

I'm explaining my issue.

I've :

    - several projects: PR1, PR2, PR3
    - several groups of users (dev and manager) which are different for each product: PR1-dev, PR1-management, PR2-dev, PR2-management

For each project, I've:

    - one permission scheme: PR1-permission, PR2-permission
    - one notification schme: PR1-notification, PR2-notification

PR1-permission and PR2-permission are almost the same.
Differences are PR1-permission are used with PR1-dev and PR1-management groups. It's the same for PR2 project.

And this is the same for notification (PR1-notification with PR1-dev and PR1-management group).

So, I've a lot of permission scheme, and a lot of notification scheme, and a lot of group.

SO, I maybe, it should be good to have a general notification scheme for permission, notification and group and to be able to use a variable for name of permissions, notifications and group.

For exemple, a solution could be:
- in general config, enable or not variable name for permission, notification and group name
- some available variable should be "project name", "key", ....
- in creation of group, notification scheme or permission scheme, we can use a variable name. For example, <ProjName> would be substituted by the name of the project.

Don't hesitate to contact me for more explaination :)

Thanks

Mickael THIEVENT
SILKAN
fields.summary: Use a variable for name of permission scheme and notification scheme

fields.description:
If an instance has numbers in it's project key but the regex jira.projectkey.pattern doesn't allow numbers any longer then the mail handlers won't allow comments on issues in that project.

Steps to replicate:

# Click general configuration->advanced and edit jira.projectkey.pattern to be '([A-Z][A-Z0-9]+)'
# Create a project with the key TEST1
# Change jira.projectkey.pattern back to '([A-Z][A-Z]+)'
# Create an issue numbered TEST1-1
# Set up a mail handler that will comment on issues
# Send an email to the above email address with the subject 'TEST1-1' and the text 'Foo'
*RESULT:* Comment will not be added as JIRA will be unable to find 'TEST1-1'
# Change jira.projectkey.pattern back to '([A-Z][A-Z0-9]+)'
*RESULT:* The email will then be processed and the issue will be updated.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28649].
  {panel}

We have the problem detailed below.... but what would be great is if in JQL, the result set of fields can be specified in the query (similar to SELECT SQL query)...

The reason being is that the result set returned is different for every user and we need a way to return a pre-configured set of fields for a third party app, irrelevant of the logged on JIRA user.

Here is the problem we have...

When a developer uses a third party application that interfaces to JIRA using the in-built searchrequest-printable url, the JIRA user (ie developer) is logged out from JIRA and the user account (used for the search) is automatically logged into JIRA.

Here is the code used by the third party app (ie. salesforce) that searches JIRA for matching issues:

document.getElementById('jiraSearch').src="http://ir-jira.ir.local:8080/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-printable/temp/SearchRequest.html?jqlQuery=%22SF%20Related%20Cases%22=" + id18 + "&os_username=salesforce&os_password=<hidden>";

As you can see, we provide a JIRA account (called salesforce) that provides the desired fields in the search result which are needed to be shown in the salesforce application. This is achieved by having a salesforce a configured salesforce user in jira with "Configured Columns" for the search results).

So what happens when a developer is logged into JIRA using their own account, and then switch to salesforce and cause salesforce to perform a search, the search (with salesforce account info) logs out the developer from JIRA and logs in the salesforce account!!!

This then causes the developer to have to log out from JIRA and log back in as themselves....

How can we prevent the salesforce search from logging out logged in JIRA users? and also provide a known configured set of fields from the search request to the third party app...
fields.summary: Support in JQL to select fields to be displayed in the result set

fields.description:
The JWD workflow designer is leaking a reference to its ClassLoader from the MetalLookAndFeel. 

!leak-1.png!

(see https://extranet.atlassian.com/x/9Bf4dg for how to find the leak)

Basically, when JWD is loaded it will set "MetalLookAndFeel" up so that it can correctly render the workflow image. The problem is that MetalLookAndFeel keeps a static cache of the sun.awt.AppContext which eventually has a reference to a java.awt.EventQueue. The java.awt.EventQueue caches the TCC of the thread that created it which in this case is the Bundle Classloader of the JWD plugin. This is a problem because MetalLookAndFeel comes from the system classloader and is only initialised once which means that it keeps a reference to the Bundle Classloader of the first JWD around.
fields.summary: Memory Leak in the JWD

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28645].
  {panel}

This was originally filed as a support request here: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-38574 ; but they directed me that it was a feature improvement request and thus to come here.

{quote}Hi,

Our JIRA e-mail integration is working fine (all of the 'watched' issue notifications and such), and the e-mails come from jira@themis.atlassian.net, so all responses automatically go back into JIRA (posted to the issue as comments). This is all correct.

However, "mention" notification e-mails come from the user that executed the mention, which makes e-mail replies go directly back to that user, rather than back to JIRA. This is not desirable behaviour for us – we would rather that "mention" notification e-mails also come from jira@themis.atlassian.net, so that responses go back to the ticket rather than to the individual user.

Thanks.{quote}

In sum, I can easily see arguments for both sides of this (i.e. send from the executing user e-mail address vs. send from JIRA's system address).  What I am suggesting is an option that allows you to select one or the other according to your individual use case.

In our case, we very much want to keep all of the communication about an issue within JIRA, so that there is a central repository of all information about the issue -- rather than having it scattered around e-mail inboxes.

Obviously we can work around this by never replying to a "mention" e-mail, but it'd be much nicer if the "mention" e-mail could be replied to and the result was appended to the JIRA issue as a comment.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Allow option to configure JIRA "mention" e-mails to come from JIRA's address, not from the individual sender.

Steps to reproduce:

- Create *5 users* and a new project
- Stop JIRA
- Edit the file JIRA_INST/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/jpm.xml
- Change the tag *jira.ajax.autocomplete.userpicker.limit* value to *4*

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28635].
  {panel}

We have a lot of drop down in JIRA, Issue Type, Priority etc. that have replaced simple Select lists. The key difference between the two that I find really frustrating.


Consider this scenario. I want to lower to priority of this field using a normal select list. Ordering matters (is critical, in fact) in this case. 

I click on the field.

!https://img.skitch.com/20120621-k8nxyyjiec39qebkwhennxjhnq.png!

For a normal select list, it clearly shows where my current selection is (highlighted). I can easily select the item below or above it. Since the order matters, I also see where in the range of values my select is.

!https://img.skitch.com/20120621-k51kuddfgmcnq2e5u2mgrm32b4.png!

For the Frotherized drop down, you don't see the selected value in the list. You don't know what's above or below the current select value and you need to already know where the value sits in the continuum. The _first_ item on that list is what's selected, which isn't really what you want. From a keytboard shortcut it also doesn't really work.


h2. Thoughts on a solution

This is a big problem on fields / lists where order is critical (priority fields) and an annoyance on places where order is not critical (e.g. Rapid board drop down in GH, I know the board I care about all start with Bamboo, it'd be _nice_ if that area was highlighted).


I understand the heritage of Frother as an auto-complete / type ahead and search replacement,, rather than a select list but if we're going to support having the down arrow on the right and ability to use it like a select list, it really needs to work like one when you click on it.

I think it would work if:

* When no text has entered in the input field, onclick or on down arrow, show all values (if the drop arrow mode enabled) with the current value highlighted
* If you start typing in the field, the current behaviour is used. 

This is a pattern that's starting to repeat itself in a lot of places, and I think we need to seriously look at it from a overall UX perspective.

Maybe FEF or Design Trunk should look at this to get some consistency?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28624].
  {panel}

Currently we advise a user to go through some steps and is led to one that gets them to do something that isn't useful. In our JIRA044, JIRA050, JIRA051 or JIRA docs:

# They follow the [create a keystore file|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Running+JIRA+over+SSL+or+HTTPS#RunningJIRAoverSSLorHTTPS-1. CreatetheKeystoreFile] and generate a CSR.
# We ask them to [export the certificate|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Running+JIRA+over+SSL+or+HTTPS#RunningJIRAoverSSLorHTTPS-2.ExporttheCertificate] from their keystore.
# We then ask them to [import the certificate into the cacerts trustStore|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Running+JIRA+over+SSL+or+HTTPS#RunningJIRAoverSSLorHTTPS-ImportCertificateIntoTheTruststore]. The truststore is designed for certificate authority (CA) certs (e.g.: godaddy/rapidssl/verisign certs) and should mostly have all of the default CA certs. The only time they would need to do this is if the CA is not already loaded or the CA cert is self-signed. Step 1 gets them to sign a standard certificate, not a CA.

We don't need to ask them to do steps 2 & 3 as when the CSR is generated in step 1, it gets automatically imported and by default when Tomcat starts up it will use the keystore generated in step 1 (provided they did it as the correct user). You could remove the section in the attached screenshot as steps 2 and 3 aren't necessary.

We also don't warn the user that when using the keytool, it will default to the user's home directory that is running that command - this could lead to problems if they run it as a user that doesn't execute Tomcat. For example:

# The bundled Linux installer sets up JIRA as the {{jira}} user.
# Tomcat defaults to the {{~jira/.keystore}} file for the user that executes it.
# If a customer generates the keytool as a user other than {{jira}}, it will not put it in {{~jira/.keystore}}, so Tomcat will not have the correct keystore.

Could you please add something in like the below for step 1:

(i) On Linux, please ensure this command is run as the user that Tomcat runs on. By default, this is {{jira}} when using the bundled installer.

And also change "2. Import certificate into the trust store" so that we're clear that the user only needs to do this step if they have a CA certificate that is not already in cacerts.

Please let me know if you need clarification or anything - thanks! :)

fields.description:
There is a memory leak in Guice 3.0 and before as we embed it in OSGi. We need to update SOY templates to a version of Guice that uses guava r4+ rather than google-collections. Details below.

Soy template renderer has an embedded copy of Google Guide (rc2?). Google Guice (3.0-rc2 - 3.0) embeds a copy of google collections in {{com.google.inject.internal.util}} (*NOTE*: It runs a transform across these classes during its build so they start with $. For example, MapMaker -> $MapMaker).

This version of google-collections is loaded from the OSGi classloader of the plugin. This version of google-collections forks a thread called $Finalizer to remove weak/soft entires from maps created with $MapMaker (which Guice uses internally). The $Finalizer thread needs to be shutdown automatically when no longer used. It does this by listening when the OSGi classloader is destroyed (though Weak/Phantom references) and kills itself. For this to work the $Finalizer thread must not have a strong reference to the OSGi classloader either directly or indirectly (i.e. it can't strongly reference any class or instance of class loaded by the OSGi classloader). If it gets a strong reference to the OSGi classloader that OSGi classloader will not be collected. Further, because the OSGi classloader is never destroyed the $Finalizer thread will never exit which will keep the OSGi classloader around. Memory leak.

The authors of $Finalizer went to great pains to avoid a strong reference between it and the OSGi classloader. For example, $Finalizer is loaded in its own class loader and only keeps weak/phantom references to the OSGi classloader. It also used reflection extensively. The problem that SOY has is that the $Finalizer thread is forked from a thread that has its ThreadContextClassloader set to the OSGi classloader. When this happens the $Finalizer inherits this TCC and as such has a strong reference to the OSGi classloader. 

The master of Guice currently embeds guava 11 instead of the old and defunct google-collections. Guava has not used the $Finalizer since guava 3. Simply updating to a version of Guice that uses guava 4+ will fix this memory leak.
fields.summary: Atlassian Soy Template Renderer Has PermGen memory Leak

1) Open a saved filter.
2) Open a different saved filter in a different tab or window.

Usually reindexing JIRA fixes this error for a while but it keeps happening. This is caused by the "Components" field being hidden in some field configurations associated to the project. 

*Workaround*: show the "Components" field in all the field configurations associated to the projects. After changing this, it is necessary to Reindex JIRA so changes can take effect.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28614].
  {panel}

Hi,

Today, when I'm creating a bug, my bug is in Open status.
However, I would like to have a different status if my bug is assigned to somebody at the creation.
Is it possible to have this behaviour in JIRA?

Steps would be:
1/ Create an issue
2/ assign issue to somebody during the creation
3/ status will be "assigned" after my click on "Create" button
   Moreover, if the assignee is "unassigned", status must be open after my click on "Create" button

Mickael THIEVENT
SILKAN
fields.summary: Status when I'm creating issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28613].
{panel}
h3. Summary

I have tested JIRA version 4.4.3, 4.4.5 and 5.0.5 and found that JIRA throws an error while translating status with if description string exceeds 255 characters.

Step to reproduce:
 # Log in as a user with the JIRA Administrators global permission.
 # Go to Administration>Statuses
 # Add a new status and make it's description more than 255 character
 # Click "Translate"
 # Copy Status name and description set and paste to the relevant Name and Description text field
 # Select any Language from "View Language Translations", click Update
 # JIRA will throw an error as the attached 'Error translating status.png'

h3. Notes

This bug not only affects Status *translation*, but also affects other translations e.g. Resolutions and Custom Fields. If this is gonna be fixed, the followings should be fixed altogether:
 * [Error occured when translating description longer than 255 characters|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-14633]
 * [Translation of a custom field allows only 255 characters|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-61591]

 (+) On top of that, there's a Suggestion that the Description field should be converted to a textarea instead, similar to the one in Announcement Banner, for better visibility (see JRASERVER-67635).
fields.summary: Error Translating Issue Status with more than 255 characters of description

fields.description:
We have listener on all Issue Events.
When I comment issue with "Comment" button or during other standard actions like Updating, Resolving or closing issue, IssueCommented or IssueUpdated or Resolved or Closed event is fired but when I link issue and comment in one action no event is fired. 

I know that there is no Link Issue Event in JIRA so far but in this case IssueCommented event should be fired.
fields.summary: IssueCommented Event is not fired when Link Issue with comment action is performed.

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*
# Search for issue at Issue Navigator

*Workaround*

# Share the result

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28599].
  {panel}

We have a geographically disperse development organization that consists of smaller self-contained development groups.  The smaller groups have the latitude to use different development life cycle methods.  For instance, one organization uses a waterfall methodology, while another uses scrum.  

Despite having these various methodologies, we wish to have a single issue tracking system because we have a single overarching CM and QA organization.  While this may not seem ideal, it fits us well because we have different delivery models (some are customer oriented and necessitate a waterfall, others are product oriented and can successfully use scrum).  

Our request is to allow JIRA and GreenHopper to have different licenses counts.  It's frustrating (and a waste of money) to us to have to license GreenHopper at the same level as JIRA, when only a percentage of the GreenHopper licenses will actually be used.  

It's a testament to how we like JIRA as a bug tracker that we are considering making the move to it organizationally.  However, because the perception is that we are wasting money on GreenHopper licenses, it may sway our decision making otherwise (at least in the form of deciding on a scrum product).
fields.summary: Configure GreenHopper to have different number of licenses than JIRA
